This manual describes version &appletversion; of &applet;.
Feedback
To report a bug or make a suggestion regarding the &applet; applet or this manual, follow the directions in the GNOME Feedback Page.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &applet; applet checks your mail server at regular intervals to determine if there is new mail in your mailbox. The applet displays a message to inform you whether you have new mail.

To add &applet; to a panel, right-click on the panel, then choose
Add to Panel Internet Inbox Monitor .

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: To check the mail server for new messages, right-click on the applet, then choose Check for mail. &applet; contacts the mail server to determine if there is new mail on the server.
You can configure &applet; to run a command when you click on the applet. See for information about how to configure &applet; to run commands.

sect1.title: Preferences
sect1.para: To configure &applet;, right-click on the applet, then choose Preferences.

listitem.para: Select this option to run a command when &applet; detects new mail. Type the command in the text box provided. For example, type fetchmail to run the fetchmail program to retrieve mail from a remote mail server.

Select this option to run a command when you click on the &applet; applet. Type the command in the text box provided. For example, to start a Netscape Messenger window when you click on the applet, type netscape -mail in the text box.

term.guilabel: Set the number of unread mails to zero

listitem.para: Select this option to set the number of unread messages to zero when you click on the applet.
Use this spin box to specify how often &applet; checks the mail server to determine if there is new mail.

term.guilabel: Play a sound when new mail arrives

listitem.para: Select this option to play a default sound when the applet finds new mail on the mail server. The default sound file is specified in $prefix/etc/sound/events/mailcheck.soundlist.
Use this drop-down list box to select the type of display to use in the applet. You can display text, an image, or an animation.
Select one of the following options from the drop-down list box to specify the type of mail server on which your mailbox resides:
If your mailbox resides on a shared mail spool area on a local mail server.
If your mailbox is set up as a maildir mailbox that resides in your local directory tree.
If your mailbox resides on a remote Post Office Protocol 3 (POP3) mail server.
If your mailbox resides on a remote Internet Message Access Protocol (IMAP) server.
If you select Local mailspool or Local maildir as your mailbox location, use this field to specify the location to check for new messages.
If you select Remote POP3-server or Remote IMAP-server as your mailbox location, use this text box to specify the name of the remote mail server.
If you select Remote POP3-server or Remote IMAP-server as your mailbox location, use this text box to specify the username to access the remote mail server.
If you select Remote POP3-server or Remote IMAP-server as your mailbox location, use this text box to specify the password to access the remote mail server.
If you select Remote IMAP-server as your mailbox location, use this text box to specify the folder on the server that contains your mailbox.

term.guilabel: Command to run before checking for mail

listitem.para: If you select Remote POP3-server or Remote IMAP-server as your mailbox location, use this text box to specify a command to run before &applet; checks the mail server for new mail.
